summary: User requests a warning when sending unregistered signals to workflows. Currently, handle.signal() succeeds silently even when the workflow has no handler for that signal, making debugging difficult. A warning message should be logged by the Worker to help users identify misspelled signals or missing handler registrations.
userImpact: Users debugging signal handling issues spend time troubleshooting why their signal handlers aren't running when signals are silently ignored.
proposedFix: Log a warning message when a workflow receives a signal without a registered handler, including common causes (misspelling, missing setHandler call, outdated worker code)
keyQuote: They likely meant to send a registered signal and are wondering why their signal handler isn't running.
